author: gstein
msg: Consolidate the opening of RA sessions into a new utility function.
[ all files in libsvn_client ]
* ra.c (svn_client__open_ra_session): new file. new function. construct
a callbacks table and open an RA session.
* delete.c (svn_client_delete): use new function.
BUG FIX: for remote deletes, do not refer to the working copy.
* checkout.c (svn_client_checkout): use new function.
* diff.c (svn_client_diff): use new function (for both sessions)
* copy.c (repos_to_repos_copy): use new function.
BUG FIX: do not use the URL as a "base directory". simply don't
refer to the working copy.
(wc_to_repos_copy): use new function (for both opening points).
(repos_to_wc_copy): use new function.
BUG FIX: do not use the URL as a "base directory". don't provide
it to RA, yet tell RA to store auth info in the resulting WC.
* log.c (svn_client_log): use new function.
NOTE: it is questionable the way it allows for errors when opening
the RA session.
* update.c (svn_client_update): use new function.
* status.c (add_update_info_to_status_hash): use new function.
NOTE: it is questionable the way it allows for errors when opening
the RA session.
* add.c (svn_client_mkdir): use new function.
BUG FIX: do not use the URL as a "base directory". simply don't
refer to the working copy.
* commit.c (send_to_repos): use new function.
* client.h (svn_client__callback_baton_t): new structure. unused for now.
(svn_client__open_ra_session): new declaration

author: kfogel
msg: Justify revisions 832, 830, 829, and 828 by finally using the
abstraction so painfully acquired:
* subversion/libsvn_wc/wc.h (svn_wc__versioned_file_modcheck):
Declare.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/questions.c (svn_wc__versioned_file_modcheck):
Remove static qualifier, move doc string to wc.h above.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/log.c (log_do_committed): Handle eol conversion
and keyword expansion by using svn_wc__versioned_file_modcheck to
compare working file with tmp text base.

author: sussman
msg: New EOL logic for 'svn diff'.
* diff.c (file_diff, close_file): when printing a diff between a
working file and its text-base, first check for an eol-style of
'native'.  If present, run diff on an untranslated copy of the
working file.

author: cmpilato
msg: * subversion/tests/libsvn_subr/subst-test.c
(lines): Revert previous change (revision 831).  The current testing
framework in this file isn't conducive to testing consecutive
newlines of random style.  For example, the source file may have the
following sequence of consecutive newlines: '\n' '\r'.  The
newline translation routine is greedy, though, so it parses those
"two" lines as only one, ending with '\n\r'.  The testing setup in
this file doesn't allow for the possibility of the number of "lines"
in a file changing.

author: kfogel
msg: * subversion/libsvn_wc/questions.c (svn_wc__versioned_file_modcheck):
New function, this is the abstraction I meant to make in revision 828.
(svn_wc_text_modified_p): Use above new function.
